intro: Sinosasa longiligulata, commonly known as the long-lipped bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement, and it produces small, oval berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats at higher elevations.
